title: The Dreaming. Series 4
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Animation (Cinematography)
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Animators
abstract: 4 tapes, 1 booklet. Tape 1: The Dreaming and reconciliation (12 mins.)--Tape 2: 4 stories (each 11-13 mins. duration) Didipapa and Gorarasiasi ; Buillbree ; The creation of Trowenna (Tasmania) ; The Hawkesbeak turtle (48 mins. total)--Tape 3: 4 stories (each 11-13 mins. duration) How the desert came to be ; The Mountain devil ; Dolphin dreaming ; Doitborke (48 mins. total)--Tape 4: 5 stories (each 9-11 mins. duration) The Making of the Fitzroy River ; Giant man ; Ant eggs ; Tjubpy the cheeky little lizard ; Wanka Manapulpa Minyma (The trapdoor spider woman) (48 mins. total) Booklet: Teacher's guide
description: Series four of "The Dreaming" consists of thirteen of a total of 78 short animations of Aboriginal Dreaming stories that make up the six part series. The support video accompanying series four focuses on the importance of cultural maintenance in the journey towards reconciliation. This rich and ambitious project was produced by Aboriginal Nations, an independent animation company committed to employing Aboriginal animators. With reference to an intellectual property protocol developed by the company, the stories were sourced from Aboriginal communities, and the permission to tell and animate them was obtained from community elders. The soundtracks utilise the voices of Aboriginal actors and feature original music by Aboriginal composers. A comprehensive teachers guide and supporting videos introducing the Dreaming and offering insights into the storytelling and animation process are also included.
